channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: To rebuild from war, Syrian firefighters work to rebuild trust -- in each other
item.description: They were on opposite sides during Syria's civil war and now must do lifesaving work together. A makeshift brick wall divides them in their Damascus f...

item.title: DOGE keeps gaining access to sensitive data. Now, it can cut off billions to farmers
item.description: DOGE recently gained high-level access to a database that controls government payments and loans to farmers and ranchers across the U.S.

item.title: Data reveals FEMA missed major flood risks. And, measles hit highest level in decades
item.description: New data reveals FEMA missed major flood risks at Camp Mystic, where over two dozen died in the Texas flood. And, U.S. measles cases hit the highest l...

item.title: Kerr County struggled to fund flood warnings. Under Trump, it's getting even harder
item.description: Kerr County applied for federal grants to build a warning system to protect residents from flash floods. Under the Trump administration, that kind of ...

item.title: Photos: Before-and-after satellite images show extent of Texas flooding destruction
item.description: Before-and-after images show how the Guadalupe River surged and devastated towns across Texas.

item.title: Five things Trump should know about Liberia and why they speak 'good English'
item.description: Liberia was founded by freed slaves and the country has long-standing historical ties with the US.

item.title: Children queuing for supplements killed in Israeli strike in Gaza, hospital says
item.description: Eight children were among 15 people reportedly killed while queuing outside a clinic in the central town of Deir al-Balah.

item.title: Insurance, mortgages and credit cards: Jill Schlesinger breaks down your financial questions
item.description: CBS News business analyst Jill Schlesinger answers viewer questions from life insurance and lowering bills to your mortgage and the impact of cancelin...

item.title: New documentary explores how shooter accessed Trump Butler event for assassination attempt
item.description: In the new documentary "In the Crosshairs: The Attempted Assassination of Donald Trump," CBS News Pittsburgh explores the questions that remain unansw...

item.title: Texas officials are trying to figure out who’s really missing from the floods
Brazil vows to match US tariffs after Trump threatens 50% levy
item.description: Trump's threat is over what he calls the "mistreatment" of his ally, ex-President Jair Bolsonaro.

item.title: EU chief von der Leyen survives rare confidence vote
item.description: The outcome of the vote was not a surprise - but the fact it came about at all was not a positive signal for von der Leyen.

item.title: Jack Alcott previews debut of "Dexter: Resurrection," and talks about reprising his role
item.description: "Dexter: Resurrection" debuts on Friday with actor Jack Alcott reprising his role for the series. The show left off with Dexter's son, Harrison – play...

item.title: Whistleblower's texts suggest Trump nominee Bove urged lawyer to defy court order
item.description: The Senate panel considering Emil Bove's nomination to be a judge has emails regarding allegations he advised DOJ to defy court orders.

item.title: Heroics of Texas camp counselors cast spotlight on those who oversee millions of US kids each summer
Hundreds gather at high school stadium to honor the many lost to deadly Texas floods
item.description: Several hundred people have gathered for a worship ceremony at a high school stadium in Texas. The vigil was held Wednesday evening to remember of the...

item.title: US cuts visa validity for applicants from three African countries
item.description: The United States announces sweeping changes to its non-immigrant visa policy for Cameroon, Ethiopia and Nigeria.

item.title: Growing demands from employers for workers seeking new jobs
item.description: Some U.S. employers are seeking new workers who are willing to work longer hours and meet higher demands. Lindsay Ellis, a reporter for The Wall Stree...
